unnormalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural India**
normalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26th - A significant push for renewable energy in rural India is underway, promising cleaner energy access and reduced reliance on fossil fuels. Dr. Meena Sharma, a leading researcher at IIT-Bombay, highlights the potential of solar microgrids in electrifying remote villages.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth - A significant push for renewable energy in rural India is underway, promising cleaner energy access and reduced reliance on fossil fuels. Doctor Meena Sharma, a leading researcher at I I T hyphen Bombay, highlights the potential of solar microgrids in electrifying remote villages.

unnormalised: The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) has announced a new scheme, allocating Rs. 500 crores to support the installation of solar power plants across the states of Rajasthan and Gujarat. This initiative aims to power homes and agricultural activities.
normalised: The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) has announced a new scheme, allocating rupee five hundred crore to support the installation of solar power plants across the states of Rajasthan and Gujarat. This initiative aims to power homes and agricultural activities.

unnormalised: Each village will receive a plant capable of generating sufficient electricity for its needs. The average plant will cover approximately 5000 sq ft. and feature battery storage solutions.
normalised: Each village will receive a plant capable of generating sufficient electricity for its needs. The average plant will cover approximately five thousand square feet. and feature battery storage solutions.

unnormalised: The project draws inspiration from the traditional diya lighting during Diwali, signifying a transition towards brighter, cleaner energy futures. This initiative will reduce carbon emissions and create employment opportunities in renewable energy sectors, fostering sustainable development at the grassroots level. Further expansion to other states is planned based on the success of these pilot projects.
normalised: The project draws inspiration from the traditional diya lighting during Diwali, signifying a transition towards brighter, cleaner energy futures. This initiative will reduce carbon emissions and create employment opportunities in renewable energy sectors, fostering sustainable development at the grassroots level. Further expansion to other states is planned based on the success of these pilot projects.
